column1:
TAM001: Does your company have a Technology Asset Management Plan, Policy or Procedure(s)?  

If yes, please attach the Policy, Plan, or Procedure.
Artifact Required: Technology Asset Management Policy

Design Elements:
1. Requirements to maintain a Hardware Inventory
2. Requirements to maintain a Software Inventory
column5:
Integral Development Corporation does have a technology asset management plan, policy or procedure(s) in place.



The following design elements are in place:
1. Requirements to maintain a Hardware Inventory
    Integral Asset Management Policy.pdf [Stage 5] - Page 1 

2. Requirements to maintain a Software Inventory
    Integral Asset Management Policy.pdf [Stage 5] - Page 1




Assessor work steps: 
The assessor's comments were completed through review of the Third Party response, inspection of evidence and inquiry with Seeja Jiju, Program Manager on 07/23/2021.

Evidence referenced:
Integral Asset Management Policy.pdf [Stage 5]

column1:
TAM002: Does your company have a process for controlling the acquisition of technology assets? 

If yes, please describe the process followed in your company to authorize and acquire technology assets.
column3: Please refer to the Integral's asset management policy document.
column5:
Integral Development Corporation does have a process for controlling the acquisition of technology assets in place.

Integral's CIO must review and approve all technology asset acquisitions. 

The assessor validated through inquiry, the CIO must authorize all technology assets prior to use. Once a new asset is acquired, it must be hardened, approved and reviewed. 

Assessor work steps: 
The assessor's comments were completed through review of the Third Party response, inspection of evidence and inquiry with Seeja Jiju, Program Manager on 07/23/2021.

Evidence referenced:
Integral Asset Management Policy.pdf [Stage 5]

column1:
TAM003: Does your company have a process to maintain an inventory of hardware, software and physical technology assets (e.g., backup tapes, Tokens, Smart Cards, CDs, thumb drives)?

If yes, please describe.
Artifact Required: Screenshot of software and hardware inventory showing attributes captured

Design Elements:
1.  Asset Identification (e.g., Tag or ID Number, Serial Number, or MAC ID)
2. Asset Type Designation of Hardware, Software, or Physical (or equivalent)
3. Asset Classification (according to Data Classification requirements) and information included in asset
4. Item Description
column5:
Integral Development Corporation does have a process to maintain an inventory of hardware, software, and physical technology assets (e.g., backup tapes, tokens, smart cards, CDs, thumb drives) in place.

The following design elements are in place:
1.  Asset Identification (e.g., Tag or ID Number, Serial Number, or MAC ID)
    Asset Inventory - Section: Product Name/Serial Number

2. Asset Type Designation of Hardware, Software, or Physical (or equivalent)
    Asset Inventory - Section: OS

3. Asset Classification (according to Data Classification requirements) and information included in asset
    Asset Inventory - Section: Name

4. Item Description
    Asset Inventory - Section OS, Product Name


Assessor work steps: 
The assessor's comments were completed through review of the Third Party response, inquiry with Seeja Jiju, Program Manager on 07/23/2021 and observation of evidence.

Evidence referenced:
Asset Inventory - Documents were not retained but inspected and validated remotely.

column1:
TAM004: Does your company have a technology asset disposal procedure for the disposal, reuse, or repair of electronic media (e.g., hardware, end-user devices, tapes, disk drives, multifunction devices, copiers)?

If yes, please attach the procedure which covers the listed design elements.
Artifact Required: Technology Asset Disposal Procedure

Design Elements:
1. Removal of information, using industry- secure methods, to ensure data cannot be recovered
2. When requested, a notification to customer of removal/destruction information from decommissioned assets is completed
3. Process in place to ensure devices are protected when data cannot be removed.
column5:
Integral Development Corporation does have a technology asset disposal procedure for the disposal, reuse, or repair of electronic media (e.g., hardware, end-user devices, tapes, disk drives, multifunction devices, copiers) in place.



However, the following design elements are not in place: 
3. Process in place to ensure devices are protected when data cannot be removed.

The following design elements are in place:
1. Removal of information, using industry- secure methods, to ensure data cannot be recovered
    Integral Asset Management Policy.pdf [Stage 5] - Page 1

2. When requested, a notification to customer of removal/destruction information from decommissioned assets is completed - Validated through inquiry. 



Assessor work steps: 
The assessor's comments were completed through review of the Third Party response and inspection of evidence.

Evidence referenced:
Integral Asset Management Policy.pdf [Stage 5]

column1:
TAM005: Does your company have a process for removing physical technology property, such as hardware and backup tapes, from the premises?

If yes, please describe.
column3: Please refer to the Integral's asset management policy and backup policy documents.
column4:
Integral Asset Management Policy.pdf [Stage 5](file)
07-01 Backup Procedure.pdf [Stage 5](file)
column5:
Integral Development Corporation does have a process for removing physical technology property, such as hardware and backup tapes, from the premises in place.

Integral has a process for removing physical technology property from the premises by degaussing, overwrite or securely remove all assets. The regional System Administrator will be responsible for ensuring all such equipment is destroyed when it is retired from use. 



Assessor work steps: 
The assessor's comments were completed through review of the Third Party response, inspection of evidence and inquiry with Seeja Jiju, Program Manager on 07/23/2021.

Evidence referenced:
Integral Asset Management Policy.pdf [Stage 5]

column1: TAM006: Does your company formally request the return of all corporate assets for terminated employees by their last day of work and reconcile received assets to the inventory ensuring the receipt of all assets?
column5:
Integral Development Corporation does formally request the return of all corporate assets for terminated employees by their last day of work and reconcile received assets to the inventory ensuring the receipt of all assets.





Assessor work steps: 
The assessor's comments were completed through review of the Third Party response.
